name: Sunday camachile
description: Delve into the heart of healthy Filipino cuisine with our Sunday camachile recipe. This dish is marvelously low-sodium and low-sugar, combining the unique flavors of Manila Tamarind with a medley of fresh vegetables and fish. Perfect for those looking to enjoy traditional flavors while keeping their meals nutritious and health-friendly. This recipe is a tribute to healthy eating without compromising on taste, making it a perfect addition to your collection of healthy recipes.
recipeIngredient: 0.50  cup chopped, Sweet potato leaves, raw

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Manila Tamarind, tomatoes, carrots, asparagus, and potato under cold water.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the Filipino-Dried Mackerel in water for 10 minutes to rehydrate.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the tomatoes, carrots and potato. Cut the asparagus into 1-inch pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the Rib Roast in a pan over medium heat for about 10 minutes until browned and tender. Remove and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, add the rehydrated Mackerel, diced vegetables, and Manila Tamarind. Cook for 7 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Add the fresh Lumpia and Vegetable Kare-kare mix to the pan. Combine thoroughly and cook for another 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Lastly, stir in the sweet potato leaves and cook until just wilted, about 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7
